author: J0rgen
title: "Give it here Malfoy!"
review:
This is probably the worst Harry Potter set ever made. Even though it has the remembral, the only reason to get this set actually, it does not have too much else... I had nearly all the Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone sets, thus I already had both the Harry Potter and the Draco Malfoy-minifigures. Had this set been released in 2001, with the rest of the Philosopher's Stone sets, it would have been a great way to get Malfoy, as the only set to get him at that point was in the rather expensive 4709 Hogwarts Castle. However, this set was released in 2002, when there were Malfoy's all over the place, in Chamber of Secrets, Malfoy plays a larger role and therefore was in more sets. Since neither of the minifigures were exclusive, there wasn't any real reason to get the set. Except for the remembral.

As readers of the book will know, the remembral belonged to Neville Longbottom(I'm writing that in the past-tense because I believe it's mentioned that he lost it at some later point) and as LEGO-enthusiasts will know, Neville Longbottom was not released until the Prisoner of Azkaban set 4752-Professor Lupin's Classroom. Had Neville Longbottom been in this set, it would have been a lot better. As it was, there wasn't any real reason to get it, unless it was your first Harry Potter set and you had neither of the figures, nor any broomsticks.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Harry Potter - Flying Lesson
review:
The Flying Lesson (4711) is a LEGO Harry Potter set which came out in 2002. It comes with 2 minifigs and 23 pieces. This set does include no decals and there're no mistakes in the instructions and no missing pieces.

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/4711-1.jpg[/img]


Minifigures:

Harry Potter: Harry Potter comes with a gray uniform with some red markings and the gryffindor badge. He also comes with a black cape with some stars, black hair and on his face you can see that Harry is wearing glasses and you can also find his scar.

Draco Malfoy: Draco Malfoy comes with the same uniform as Harry except he got the green markings and the slytherin badge. His hair is blond and he has a serious look on his face. He is the character who's going to steal Neville Longbottom's remembrall after Neville had an accident. The remembrall is as big as a head of a minifig and it's a clear piece with a golden stripe on it.

Flying Lesson:

The flying lesson is part of the first movie from the Harry Potter saga. The small set was put together really quick when I opened the bag. I'm sure you won't need longer than 5 minutes to build that wagon which has a handle for the broom on each side. This set comes with two brooms. This set doesn't have no play features but I wish they could have put in a part of the Hogwarts castle and some more students in this set to make this scene better. I think there're better LEGO Harry Potter sets which you should get first before you get this model.



Positive:

Great pieces which you can use for brickfilms or MOC's
Minifigs
Great starter set
Remembrall


Negative:

No play features
Too easy to build


All in all this set is okay and I would recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full galery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de

author: AETerry
title: Flying Lesson - Rememberall!
review:
2002 - That was a bad year for me and LEGO, mainly as there just weren't very many sets out that I wanted. At the time, I wasn't too interested in having many or any Harry Potter sets.

 

So this set comes as a Stocking Stuffer gift, so that wasn't too bad and soothed my bruised ego that somehow I was "loosing interest in legos" as I hadn't bought many that year and provided some fun for the few moments it took to put it together.

 

I've noticed, looking in other reviews and back at older HP sets, that this is indeed the only HP set to feature Neville's Rememberall.

 

It's small, two minifigures, brooms and a cart that they attach too and the Rememberall.

 

It isn't bad and I'm rather glad I do have it now as this year 2010, I am seeing some HP sets I do want to get.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Remembrall and Harry
review:
Set #4711 Flying Lesson: This little impulse set from the Harry Potter Theme is an interesting choice for a small set, it gives you yet another Harry Potter Mini-Figure, a Draco Malfoy, a small broom holding cart, two brooms and the Remembrall accessory.

 

All in all there's little else to say about this set, it has very few pieces, you don't build much, and there are no wands for the two Mini-Figures. But it is definitely a fun little set to play with and it is the only way to get a Remembrall for your custom Neville Longbottom Mini-Figure. (If you have a custom Neville that is.) It is a good deal for your money too, in spite of what you might think, because it is a great source for cheap Gryffindor and Slytherin costumes for Customizing different students of Hogwarts. I'd have to say it's a worthy addition to any Harry Potter collection.
